data.job_description:
Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. is the world leader in servicing science with annual revenue of approximately $40 B.

When you are part of the team at Thermo Fisher Scientific, you will do meaningful work, that makes a positive impact on a global scale You will find the resources here to achieve your career goals and help take science a step beyond by developing solutions for the world's toughest challenges.
This includes protecting the environment, making sure our food is safe, and helping find cures for cancer.

Thermo Fisher Scientific Viral Vector Services (VVS) is a rapidly growing, dynamic gene therapy contract development and manufacturing organization.

We are looking for top talent with proven competencies and strong values to join our team and help lead our organization into the future.
US - Sommerville , MA - Remote ; US – Remote MA,

Office location:
Trusted master data is a foundational requirement of business agility. Master Data drives informed decisions directly impacting the risk, revenue, value, and cost goals of the organization.

Master Data Analyst will be part of the VVS Supply Chain Transformation and Excellence team, responsible for analyzing and maintaining the master data of an organization.

Primary focus is on data quality, accuracy, and consistency to ensure that the organization's data is reliable and can be used effectively for various business processes and decision-making.
Responsibilities will also include managing and maintaining the master data within the SAP system.

This role has a potential to evolve into supporting in a role of Catalog Analyst to ensure that the catalog data is accurate, up-to-date, and organized in a way that facilitates easy access and retrieval of information.

Data Analysis:
Reviewing and analyzing master data and catalog data to identify any discrepancies, errors, or inconsistencies.

Data Cleansing:
Ensuring that data is cleaned and standardized to meet the organization's data quality standards.

Data Maintenance:
Regularly updating and maintaining master data records and catalog data to reflect changes accurately.

Data Governance:
Implementing and adhering to data governance policies and procedures to ensure data integrity.
• Conducting audits and checks to ensure that the data complies with the organization's standards and guidelines.

Continuous Improvement:
Identifying opportunities for process improvement and efficiency in master data management and catalog management.
• Generating reports and metrics related to master data quality and performance.
• Troubleshooting data-related issues and implementing data governance policies.
• Creating, updating, and validating master data records to ensure accuracy and consistency.
• Working closely with different departments or teams to understand their data needs and provide accurate and relevant master data.

Dictionary and content management:

Apply, develop skill and knowledge in using and sustaining various data management tools, techniques, workflows, SharePoint based structure or any other methods.
College or University graduate degree preferably in Computer Science, Data Science, Advanced Analytics, Systems Engineering, or similar field. MBA is a plus.
SAP Certifications preferred.
5 plus years of master data experience and supply chain functional knowledge
• Knowledge of Enterprise solutions (SAP and BI) and Master Data Management solutions
• Strong knowledge of SAP modules and data management principles is essential for this role
• Sound knowledge of ERP system processes and experience working with IT
• Pharma, Biologics operations experience a plus.
• Advanced proficiency with Microsoft (MS) applications and Power Apps.
• Supporting overall data strategy and executing at a Tactical and Operational Level.
• Thorough knowledge of the latest developments in Master Data Management, processes and systems including SAP and MDM/MDG systems
• Strong attention to details and organizing and maintaining the information used for making changes and updates to the data
• Analytical mindset and comfortable manipulating large data sets, critical thinking skills and can visualize metrics to clearly communicate key insights
• Solid understanding of data sources, data structure and relationships, data organization and storage and experience with reporting packages
• Develops new and better ways of doing things, consistently strives to improve skills and knowledge in related field.
• Effective communicator, ability to work closely with different departments or teams to understand their data needs and provide accurate and relevant master data.
• Communicate risks to timelines in executing various activities.
• Ability to travel between sites to provide on-site support as required.
We offer competitive remuneration, annual incentive plan bonus scheme, healthcare, company pension, and a range of employee benefits
Thermo Fisher Scientific offers employment with an innovative, forward-thinking organization, and outstanding career and development prospects.

Thermo Fisher Scientific is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected status.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities provided with a reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform crucial job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment.

A Business Planning Senior Data Analyst develops, creates, implements, delivers, trains, and communicates new processes and controls for ZT pricing and costing teams. They will work with multiple stakeholders in the creation and delivery of solutions for the team.

Summary:

The main function of a data analyst is to coordinate changes to computer databases, test, and implement the database applying knowledge of database management systems.
A typical database analyst/programmer is responsible for planning, coordinating and implementing security measures to safeguard the computer database.

The *** Gaming team is looking for a data analyst who will work with large and complex data sets to solve a wide array of challenging problems.

data.job_title: Geospatial Data Analyst -- Maritime Experience REQUIRED
data.job_description:
Description

The Geospatial Data Analyst position directly supports key customer mission requirements for maritime safety of navigation. The position requires 5 years of prior GIS experience including but not limited to analysis, manipulate, convert, and transform geographic data into military specified compliance, while maintaining weekly and monthly milestone schedule requirements. Candidate is required to have previous employment experience working with Electronic Navigational Chart (ENC) and/or Digital Nautical Chart (DNC) data, in addition to comprehensive maritime product knowledge.

Primary Responsibilities:

Candidate should have knowledge of quality assurance/quality control to project specific guidance

Experience with GIS data conversion and cross-product schema mapping is desired

Esri ArcGIS software experience is required, to include updating geodatabases in ArcMap, managing data in ArcCatalog, utilizing various data editing toolbars

Successful candidates must display keen attention to detail and rigorous organizational skills

Working knowledge of SQL is a plus

No clearance is required, but only those who are eligible to receive one should apply

Candidates must display the ability to communicate, willingness to learn, and adaptive skills to coordinate in fast paced production environments

Telework options available.

Bachelor's degree, or relevant military experience is required. 5+ years of GIS experience

Direct experience producing Electronic Navigational Chart (ENC) and/or Digital Nautical Chart is required for consideration

Must display Maritime product knowledge

Experience performing quality assurance/quality control to project specific guidance

Knowledge of geospatial metadata, and experience meeting deadlines

Experience with validation software

No clearance required. US Citizenship required.

Preferred Qualifications

The ability to prepare reports, labor and/or cost estimates and justifications, detailed procedure documents and train staff; monitor progress; and develop scripts that automate GIS processes is desirable. Maintain knowledge of in-house and regional spatial data resources; and stay abreast of GIS software trends and best practices in spatial data management. Analyze workflows, identify, and recommend improvements. Experience with CARIS S-57 composer is a plus. Prior experience working with 7Cs Analyzer validation software is a plus. The ability to improve toolkits and establish process improvements through Python is desired. Management, creation, and validation of IHO S-57 and S-100 product specifications

Pay Range:
Pay Range $48,750.00 - $88,125.00

Additional factors considered in extending an offer include (but are not limited to) responsibilities of the job, education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities, as well as internal equity, alignment with market data, applicable bargaining agreement (if any), or other law.

A scientific leadership opportunity within a smaller growing consulting group, combining both traditional and novel analytical approaches with diverse real-world data, including genomic, medical record, claims and patient-reported information. data.job_description:
Data Analyst (Power BI)

Job ID

134943

Posted

30-Aug-2023

Service line

GWS Segment

Role type

Full-time

Areas of Interest

Digital & Technology/Information Technology

Location(s)

Remote - US - Remote - US - United States of America

Our Digital & Technology organization sits at the heart of CBRE. As part of our team, youll be able to learn from the most brilliant engineers, designers, and product managers while solving tough problems that will drive our technology forward.
• *About the Role**

The Data Analyst will be responsible for ensuring the business makes better decisions through the collection and usage of data. They will ensure business data and analysis requirements are met by accurately applying data concepts, including data structures, collection and cleansing, and structured and unstructured data analysis and reporting.
• *What Youll Do**

+ Perform ad-hoc, strategic analysis of structured and unstructured data across multiple data sources, reflecting global real estate markets and the operations of real estate assets.

+ Develop data structures and pipelines to coordinate, collect, cleanse, and standardize data in order to generate insights and address reporting needs.

+ Define data requirements and captures and validate information, using judgment and statistical tests.

+ Use programming and analytical tools, including open source programs including Python, R and SAS, SQL, Oracle, or similar relational database tools to formulate models and/or extract insights.

+ Proficient in knowledge of crafting algorithms, identifying patterns and insights from structured and unstructured data sets using graphs, trees and/or other data representation techniques as required.

+ Identifies and fixes data integration and integrity issues in agreement with the appropriate CBRE business units; Designs work flows and procedures.

+ Finds opportunities to improve data usage, applying modeling and optimization methods to develop new strategies and improve business performance.

+ Develops ad-hoc analytics and reporting based on analysis of existing data sources, using a variety of tools (i.e. SSRS, Tableau).

+ Exhibits analytical rigor, judgment, and ability to communicate a comprehensive 'data story' to multiple levels of the organization.
• *What Youll Need**

+ Bachelor's degree from a credible school in computer science, math, engineering, or related field.

+ Proven experience in quantitative analysis, data modeling, reporting, relational database tools, data warehousing, database architecture, and SQL, SAS, and/or SPSS including 2-3 years technical experience in software development, machine learning or statistical analysis, data engineering, and data visualization-related work.

+ Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Strong interpersonal and analytical skills. Ability to deliver efficient, timely, reliable, and courteous service to customers. Ability to effectively present information.

+ Experience with **Microsoft BI** stack (e.g., SSRS) a bonus.

+ Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite including Word, PowerPoint, Excel, and Outlook.

+ Strong analytical skills.
• *Why CBRE?**

CBRE is the world's largest commercial real estate services and investment firm, and we have been ranked #1 on Fortunes Worlds Most Admired Company: (2019, 2020, 2021,2023). With services, insights, and data that span every dimension of the industry, we build digital solutions for clients of every size, in every sector, and across every geography.

_Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States without the need for visa sponsorship now or in the future_

CBRE carefully considers multiple factors to determine compensation, including a candidates education, training, and experience. The minimum salary for the position is **$90,000** annually and the maximum salary for the position is **$95,000** annually. The compensation that is offered to a successful candidate will depend on the candidates skills, qualifications, and experience. Successful candidates will also be eligible for a discretionary bonus based on CBREs applicable benefit program.

CBRE is an equal opportunity employer that values diversity. We have a long-standing commitment to providing equal employment opportunity to all qualified applicants regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, veteran status, political belief, or any other basis protected by applicable law. We also provide reasonable accommodations, as needed, throughout the job application process. If you have a disability that inhibits your ability to apply for a position through our online application process, you may contact us via email at or via telephone at +1 866 225 3099 (U.S.) and +1 866 388 4346 (Canada).

NOTE: Some, but not all, of our positions may have an additional requirement to comply with COVID-19 health and safety protocols, including COVID-19 vaccination proof and/or rigorous testing. If you have questions about the requirement(s) for this position, please inform your Recruiter.

At U.S. Bank, were on a journey to do our best. Helping the customers and businesses we serve to make better and smarter financial decisions and enabling the communities we support to grow and succeed. We believe it takes all of us to bring our shared ambition to life, and each person is unique in their potential. A career with U.S. Bank gives you a wide, ever-growing range of opportunities to discover what makes you thrive at every stage of your career. Try new things, learn new skills and discover what you excel atall from Day One.
• *Job Description**

U.S. Bank is currently seeking a Data Analytics Manager for Credit Card, who will be responsible for creating and implementing advanced analytics capabilities, designing complex prospecting models, and performing advanced business intelligence analyses and other predictive methodologies. Additional responsibilities include:

Interprets results and develops actionable insights and recommendations for use across the division/company;

Acts as a liaison between the front-office and technology groups, including market and business leaders, business development teams, relationship managers of other business lines, Operations, Finance, and Marketing.
• *_This role is eligible for 100% remote_** .

Master's degree in data and technology management, or equivalent work experience

Ten or more years of experience in data management and business intelligence in the financial services industry

Preferred Skills/Experience

Understanding of common data languages (SAS, SQL, R, Python)

Displayed ability to use both structure and unstructured data environments (Oracle, Netezza, Linux, Adobe, etc.)

Ability to develop visualization and self-service tools using Power BI, Tableau, or DOMO

Understanding of basic banking concepts (revenue, risk, credit processes, compliance, technology)

Best-in-class ability to use technology to organize data and information from multiple sources

Ability to collaborate and utilize data to provide effective validation to assumptions or change the direction of the business

Light machine learning capability to run experimental tests and challenge hypotheses

Pay Rate:
$71,630 - 103,700

HiTouch is full-service company with a network of local distribution centers in the United States. HiTouch provides a wide range of office productivity services in personalized and environmentally responsible ways. After joining the Staples family in 2018, HiTouch has helped us grow alternative distribution channels.

The Sales Data Analyst will provide data-driven insights and recommendations on marketing and sales strategy. This position plays a critical role in supporting sales operations, defining marketing efforts, and driving revenue growth for HiTouch.

The Sales Data Analyst will be responsible for analyzing sales data, identifying trends and opportunities, and providing actionable insights to optimize the companys sales and marketing strategies.

Primary Responsibilities
• Provide sales strategy support through collaboration with the sales and marketing teams to develop and refine data driven sales strategies and tactics.
• Solve business problems by conducting data analysis, reporting key findings, and making recommendations for solutions.

• Source, and/or build enriched data to support sales operations.
• Identify and implement solutions for combining and consolidating data, and packaging insights into easy-to-understand and reusable formats.
• Build and maintain reports to identify data gaps and maintain data integrity.
• Enhance and maintain existing automated tools based on business needs.
• Travel to the Office for once monthly collaboration meetings.(Reimbursable)

• You understand the business needs and develop recommended approaches based on relevant data and analytics.

• You have an analytical mindset that interprets trends, issues, and data to identify, develop, and execute high impact sales programs and strategy.

• You possess strong quantitative, analytical, and problem-solving skills.
• You are a strong communicator of complex concepts and analysis.
• You are able to manage multiple projects and changing priorities in a fast-paced environment
• You have a comprehensive understanding of sales operations and enablement

Senior Data Analyst - Duluth, Ga

Our client is seeking a Senior Data Analyst to join our professional team. This hands-on individual contributor position requires the ability to collect, organize, and analyze data to provide accurate reports so that other departments can make informed decisions. In our collaborative and team-based culture, the Senior Data Analyst will work closely with other professionals involved in sales, operations, quality control, and supply chain. This is an opportunity to join a vibrant, privately held company with the excitement and growth of an entrepreneurial start-up, yet with the stability of a well established business with brand recognition and solid financials. Duties and Responsibilities
• Plan, design, prioritize, and manage market and competitive research projects to identify trends and monitor movements in the market.
• Research, track, and monitor specific areas of business interest to generate knowledge.
• Creatively scout for information sources.
• Acquire and integrate data from multiple sources, including import/export records, internet research, social media, public company financial reports, investment banker analyses, articles, and news alerts.
• Maintain existing reporting stack that consist of a variety of paginated reports and interactive dashboards that inform key decisions.
• Develop and create paginated reports and relevant dashboards that aid senior management and other departments in making informed decisions.
• Maintain internal data warehouse tables and views, creating and changing as required.
• Investigate and implement innovative and next-generation insight services, including the use of dashboards, ad-hoc visualizations, and other technologies.
• Perform other information systems functions to support the business as needed.

Qualifications
• Master's degree, preferably in information system or related field.
• Minimum of five years of experience required in research, data mining, and analysis. Keeps alert to emerging technologies.
• Fluent in Power BI and Power Query
• Proficient in Function writing in Excel, M Code and DAX Calculations
• Proficient with T-SQL and SQL Server Management Studio
• Fluent with querying with joins and unions
• Fluency in Crystal Reporting/SAP Business Objects is a plus.

data.job_description:
ConnectWise is the world's leading software company dedicated to the success of IT Solution providers. As a company our vision is to power a thriving IT ecosystem that transforms what's possible for SMBs. How we do this is by empowering IT solution providers with unmatched software, services, and community to achieve their most ambitious vision of success

ConnectWise provides a work environment where each colleague is valued for their perspectives, skills and talents, is treated respectfully, can communicate openly and is encouraged to develop to their full potential as a contributor to the success of the company and the communities we serve. We value our colleagues and offer a competitive benefits package including medical, retirement investment plans, flexible time away, community volunteer opportunities, master’s assistance program and colleague recognition programs.

General Summary:

The Analytics and Strategy Manager will be a key member of the Business Operations and Programs, functioning at the intersection of applied/operational data analytics and creative business strategy. This position will have a hybrid role of leading/managing data analytics solutions for the entire team and conducting business analysis and synthesizing recommendations for high impact strategic initiatives.

The Analytics and Strategy Manager will be primarily responsible for developing advanced analytics models/solution by leveraging data sets from a variety of operational systems across ConnectWise and leading/managing the creative application of these advanced analytical models/solutions (e.g., Machine Learning, AI, NLP, statistics) to address business challenges. This individual will also contribute (as part of a team) on business strategy projects designed to accelerate ConnectWise growth and profitability.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
• Develop end-to-end analytics solutions (including exploratory data analysis, feature engineering, model development, model validation) for various parts of the business
• Build analytical tools and dashboards to utilize curated data, and provide actionable insight into key business performance metrics including operational efficiency and revenue growth
• Problem-solve roadmap and strategy/approach with multiple stakeholders to identify/design the right advanced analytical models to solve specific problem-statements defined by leadership team
• Work alongside a multi-disciplinary team of colleagues from different backgrounds, knowledge, skills, and expertise
• Communicate and present findings/insights and model conclusions to colleagues, stakeholders, and leadership in a concise and coherent manner (including problem-solving and communicating results in simple language to non-technical audience)
• Conduct industry, market, competitor, and financial analysis and identify insightful implications for ConnectWise to drive growth and efficiencies
• Monitor market trends and competitor performance, assess implications, and develop actionable strategies
• Prepare high quality quantitative and qualitative business analysis and deliverables that clearly frame objectives, issues, and challenges, and articulate compelling, insightful findings, conclusions, and recommendations

Knowledge, Skills, and/or Abilities Required:

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
• Strong coding/programming skills in Python, R, and related advanced analytics languages
• Experience working with data visualization platforms such as PowerBI and Tableau
• Familiarity in working with SQL, Snowflake, and related platforms
• Experience in developing/building and pressure testing statistical/mathematical models – optimization models, machine learning models, deep learning models
• Exposure to working on complex business problems with multi-disciplinary teams of data scientists and business (marketing/finance/operations/other) experts
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
• Strong verbal and written communication skills including ability to clearly communicate complex analytics to non-technical audiences
• Highly collaborative, teamwork oriented working style, with demonstrated ability to think independently
• Self-starter with hands-on get-it-done attitude and strong work ethic
• High integrity and willingness to represent the core values of ConnectWise
• Must be comfortable with ambiguity and have the ability to work with and collaborate with executive leadership to help shape priorities and agendas

Educational/Vocational/Previous Experience Recommendations:
• Bachelor’s or master’s degree in data science, applied mathematics, applied statistics, economics, operations research, or related field
• 2+ years’ experience at a technology and/or management consulting firm
• 3-5 years’ experience strongly desired
• Exposure to working on data-driven business solutions alongside non-technical colleagues

Working Conditions:
• Professional office and remote environment options
• Minimal travel may be required

ConnectWise is an Equal Opportunity Employer, dedicated to building a diverse and inclusive workforce and providing a workplace free from discrimination and harassment. ConnectWise provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants without regard to race, ethnicity, color, religion, age, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, ancestry, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, genetic information, military/veteran status, marital status, familial or parental status, or any other characteristic or status protected by applicable federal, state and local laws.

The statements above are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by individuals assigned to this job. Other duties may be assigned as needed. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of the job and/or to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. If you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application and hiring process, please contact us at talentacquisition@connectwise.com or 1-800-671-6898.

About the Role

A Business Planning Senior Data Analyst develops, creates, implements, delivers, trains, and communicates new processes and controls for ZT pricing and costing teams. They will work with multiple stakeholders in the creation and delivery of solutions for the team.

What You Will Do
• Collection, organization, and manipulation of data from various sources to generate automated or systemic workflows.
• Upload, archive, and structure data in ZT warehouses (data lakes)
• Resolve issues relating to data discrepancies.
• Maintain records and files of costs and pricing.
• Preform data analysis, reports, and prepare recommendations.
• Identify/recognize problems from various perspectives (cross-org) to understand implications and propose solutions.

What You Bring
• Bachelor's degree in Business or related field
• Strong proficiency in bulk data manipulation utilizing both Python (pandas, NumPy) and SQL-structured queries
• Working knowledge of Git version control, both local commits and collaborative merge maintenance
• 3+ years of relevant experience designing and presenting visualizations from various flat data sources using Tableau
• Understanding of a standard purchase order process and its impact across business KPIs and analytics
• Familiarity with Agile project management tools (Jira, Gitlab) and a desire to utilize them
• Deep Excel familiarity including pivot tables, efficient cell referencing functions, and aggregation methodologies
• Strong collaboration and excellent written and oral communication skills
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with independent judgement to deal with ambiguity
• Attentiveness to details, accuracy, and ability to prioritize
• Advanced analytical thinking, short/ long-term planning and data analysis skills
• Strong teamwork skills to work with multiple teams across organizations
• Positive attitude and comfortable working in a fast-paced, collaborative environment
• Excellent communication, social, commercial and attentiveness to detail
• Drives for results combined with strategic agility and high quality of work

Preferred Skills
• Strong analytical skills
• Results Oriented: Drives for results combined with strategic agility and high quality of work
• Effective Communication: Share and communicate information at appropriate level of details for audiences.
• Planning and Implementation: Establish tasks, determine plans, and take actions in self-driven environment.

data.job_title: Educational Data Analyst & Staff Training Coordinator - Remote | WFH
data.job_description:
Are you fueled by the potential of educational data to drive positive change? Do you possess a knack for cultivating staff growth and development? If so, we invite you to embark on an exciting journey with us!

About Us

We're on the lookout for a dedicated Part-Time Educational Data Analyst and Staff Training Coordinator to be a vital part of our team. We're committed to enhancing education through insightful data analysis and fostering the growth of educational professionals.

Your Responsibilities

Educational Data Analysis:

Gather, dissect, and interpret enrollment-related data, providing meaningful insights.

Craft comprehensive, easy-to-understand reports that guide decision-making and strategic planning.

Forge partnerships with educational institutions to understand their data requirements, ensuring precision and uniformity.

Identify emerging patterns, trends, and avenues for refining enrollment procedures.

Staff Training & Support

Cultivate and lead training initiatives, equipping school personnel with the tools to leverage data in decision-making and more.

Provide consistent guidance to staff, ensuring their adeptness in data utilization and procedural proficiency.

Collaborate with schools to fashion tailored training regimens in alignment with their distinct needs and aspirations.

Monitor and assess the efficacy of training programs, continuously refining them for optimal impact.

Preferred Qualifications

A Bachelor’s degree in Education, Social Sciences, or a related field.

Prior involvement within an educational environment, cultivating an understanding of enrollment processes and educational metrics.

Demonstrated proficiency or a willingness to learn data analysis, capable of translating data into real-world solutions.

A proven track record in developing and spearheading training programs, grounded in adult learning principles.

Superb communication and interpersonal finesse.

Solid organizational and project management acumen.

A profound passion for education, coupled with an unwavering dedication to improving access and opportunities for marginalized communities.

Work Arrangements

This role is part-time, offering flexibility in scheduling. Anticipate contributing approximately 20 hours per week.

We fervently champion equality. Our commitment to an all-embracing environment for our team members remains steadfast. Discrimination based on race, color, religion, national origin, gender, age, disability, or any other protected status is unequivocally prohibited by us.

Are you ready to drive rapid experiments & strategic insights to optimize every aspect of customer experience?

We are looking for an analytics professional to be a creative and collaborative team member, helping develop and drive strategic analytical initiatives.

As an indispensable member of CKSI, you'll be embedded in a business unit and will be a part of an agile inter-disciplinary team with a diverse set of skills across analytics, engineering, and data science, partnering to optimize and personalize the Fidelity experience.

data.job_title: Data QA Analyst  || Fort Lauderdale, FL ( Hybrid Role: 3 days Onsite and 2 days Remote)
data.job_description:
Data QA Analyst
• supports BI & Data Engineering teams

Start Date- within 2 weeks

Location: Fort Laud, FL (hybrid) - Local Candidates only under 60 Min Commute

Description

Data QA Analyst
• supports BI & Data Engineering teams

Position Summary

We are looking for a highly motivated Quality Assurance Analyst with experience in testing BI systems and data analysis, including ETL testing and creating test approach for data testing. The ideal candidate will have experience in developing and executing test plans and cases, identifying and documenting defects, and providing recommendations for improvement to ensure the quality of BI systems and data analysis.

The Quality Assurance Analyst will work closely with cross-functional teams including data analysts, developers, and business analysts to develop and execute test plans, test cases, and test scripts for BI systems and data analysis processes, including ETL processes. The successful candidate will have a strong understanding of data analysis and visualization, as well as data testing tools such as QuerySurge.

Organizational Relationships
• IT Leadership: Managers, Directors, and senior Directors
• IT Teams: BI, BA, Security, DevOps, DBA, Architecture, Infrastructure, PMO
• Product owners /Product stakeholders
• Scrum team members: Developers, Business Analysts, Data Analysts, Project Managers

Key Responsibilities
• Develop and execute test plans, test cases, and test scripts for BI systems and data analysis processes, including ETL processes
• Identify and document defects, and work with cross-functional teams to resolve issues
• Collaborate with business analysts, data analysts, and developers to ensure that requirements are properly translated into test plans and test cases
• Analyze data to identify trends, patterns, and insights that can improve the quality of BI systems and data analysis
• Identify opportunities for process improvement and make recommendations to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of BI systems and data analysis, including ETL processes
• Work with cross-functional teams to ensure that data is accurate, complete, and timely
• Ensure that data is properly transformed and loaded into BI systems
• Create test approach for data testing, including developing test scenarios, test cases, and test data
• Use data testing tools such as QuerySurge to validate data quality and integrity

Qualifications
• Bachelor's degree in computer science, information systems, or related field
• 3+ years of experience in Quality Assurance, software testing, or related field
• Experience in testing BI systems and data analysis processes, including ETL processes
• Strong understanding of data analysis and visualization
• Experience in creating test approach for data testing, including developing test scenarios, test cases, and test data
• Experience using data testing tools such as QuerySurge to validate data quality and integrity
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
• Ability to work independently and as part of a team
• Attention to detail and accuracy
• Knowledge of SQL and data modeling is preferred

If you meet the qualifications and have experience in testing BI systems and data analysis processes, including ETL processes, creating test approach for data testing, and using data testing tools such as QuerySurge, and are a highly motivated and results-oriented individual with a strong background in quality assurance and data analysis, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity.

data.job_description:
Our client, a global consulting firm that specializes in Operational Excellence programs for life sciences companies, is actively recruiting for a very bright, skilled and self-directed Analyst to join its Client Services team.

The firm is engaged by companies to lead process optimization, capital improvements and operational excellence initiatives. Consulting teams are assigned to engagements and deliver analyses and action plans to optimize efficiency, productivity and quality.

This Analyst will be instrumental in collecting, synthesizing, analyzing and reporting on the data essential to these efforts. This is an outstanding opportunity to join a high impact, high growth company and build a career as an analyst or consultant.

Top recent Data Analytics (or similar) grads are welcome to apply. Training will be provided.

Things to Note:
• These are challenging roles. Objectives may vary with engagements, but typical duties will include:
• ----Collaborating with client teams to translate business requirements into visualization solutions
• ----Collecting, analyzing, and interpreting data to provide insights and support decision-making processes
• ----Identifying trends, patterns, and correlations in large datasets to uncover actionable insights
• ----Designing and developing visual reports, KPI scorecards, dashboards etc. using tools such as Tableau/Power BI to effectively communicate data findings
• The first engagement will involve working with an AgBio client that has developed sustainable crop fertilizers that improve farmers' productivity and profitability without contributing to climate change or pollution.
• The consulting firm is working with the company's R&D group to implement strategies to improve development processes and increase efficiencies.
• This Analyst will provide Analytics and Visualization support for these Operational Excellence initiatives.
• The Analyst, in collaboration with management, will prepare operational reporting and/or performance dashboards to improve decision-making and provide analytical insight for the team. They will also support the Project Manager by tracking data related to the progress of the project (timelines, deliverables, change orders, etc.).
• This is a key support role to the PM, and we seek an organized and focused deputy.
• The firm uses a variety of tools including Excel, Alteryx, Smartsheet, Tableau, Power BI, PowerPoint, etc. Familiarity with these tools (or similar) is expected.
• Some background in statistics will be important.
• Consultants represent the firm. Although these are "relatively" junior roles they can be the face, eyes and ears of the firm on a daily basis. We seek super smart, highly industrious and highly professional candidates who have an enormous desire to learn, achieve and have impact.
• This position is hybrid in North Carolina and will require travel to client headquarters in CA (1-2 trips/month).

Targeted candidate will offer BA/BS in a related field and 1+ years' experience performing basic queries and analysis of data. Visual report building, development of analytics dashboards, and working with complex data sets will also be important.

Other priorities include:
• Proficiency in data analysis tools (Excel, Tableau, Power BI)
• Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving skills
• Excellent communication skills with the ability to present complex data findings in a clear and concise manner

Please forward resume for prompt consideration.

data.job_description:
• *Description**
• *Job Summary**

The data analyst will collect, analyze, interpret, and apply sales and marketing data to improve decision-making, accelerate revenue growth and drive related business outcomes.

This position will transform raw data into useful information, actionable insights, key metrics and easy to understand explanations that answer important sales and marketing questions for company staff and stakeholders.

This position is integral in the company pursuit of a data driven operating model (DDOM).
• *Duties & Responsibilities**

This position requires a mix of technical, analytical, and soft skills to effectively analyze data and communicate their findings. Duties and responsibilities include the following:

+ Work with stakeholders and management to prioritize business information needs.

+ Solicit and collaborate with business stakeholders to understand what data and cascading information is most helpful in aiding the most important business outcomes.

+ Identify primary, secondary, and other data sources and the tools to extract, integrate or sync data.

+ Use query tools to extract data from different types of business systems.

+ Streamline data collection methods to create automated and easy-to-use routines.

+ Append first- and third-party data to a data lake or customer data platform.

+ Apply validation rules to identify data quality issues and apply technology to resolve data quality issues where possible.

+ Perform data analysis to assess the quality and meaning of data.

+ Perform data mining and Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA) to identify, analyze, and interpret patterns and trends for predictive analytics. We seek forward-looking information.

+ Prepare dashboards and reports for management stating trends, patterns, and predictions using relevant data.

+ Work with sales managers and practitioners to identify process improvement opportunities and quantify those opportunities so they can be prioritized.

+ Present and effectively communicate data findings and insights to sales and marketing business practitioners.
• *Required Skills & Abilities**
• *Competencies required for this role include the following:**

+ Critical thinking, including the ability to approach problems logically and make informed decisions based on data.

+ Business development, sales, digital marketing domain expertise.

+ Problem-solving, including coming up with solutions to business problems using data-driven approaches.

+ Communication skills, including clearly conveying findings, both written and orally, to non-technical stakeholders.

+ Business analyst skills, including strong conversation skills to elicit objectives and requirements from staff and management.

+ Analytical skills, including the ability to visualize and measure data flows with business processes. This includes data mapping techniques, such as Universal Process Notation (UPN), the Component Business Model (CBM) or Agile Value Stream Mapping.

+ Create highly visual dashboards and reports to communicate insights to stakeholders.
• *Technical skills required for this role include the following:**

+ Data governance, including data privacy, security, regulatory and compliance requirements.

+ Data management, quality, query (SQL), modeling, and integration skills.

+ Database access, retrieval, manipulation and modeling skills.

+ Business Intelligence (BI) tools such as Microsoft Power BI, Tableau, Alteryx

+ Predictive analytics tools.

+ Data append, maintenance and enrichment tools.

+ MarTech, including Marketing Automation Platforms (MAP) such as Adobe Marketo, HubSpot, Microsoft Dynamics Marketing or Salesforce Marketing Cloud.

+ Customer Data Platforms, such as the Adobe CDP, Dynamics Insights or Data Cloud.

+ CRM systems such as Microsoft Dynamics CE or Salesforce.

+ Sales Tech, including Sales Enablement, Sales Operations, and sales processes.

+ Knowledge of programming languages, such as Python (including libraries like pandas, numpy, and scikit-learn for data manipulation and analysis) and R (for statistical analysis and data visualization) are helpful, but not required.

+ Data Lakes and enterprise data warehouses.

+ AI and machine learning skills are highly regarded.
• *Required Education and/or Certifications**

+ BS in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics, Marketing

+ Digital Marketing Certifications
• *What you can expect from us:**

+ Our shared values that foster inclusion and belonging including uncompromising integrity, collaboration, trust, and mutual respect

+ The opportunity to innovate and do work that motivates and engages you

+ A collaborative environment focused on enabling you to further your career growth and continuous professional development

+ Competitive compensation and a total rewards package that focuses on all aspects of your wellbeing

+ Flexibility to do impactful work and the time to enjoy your life outside of work

+ Opportunities to connect and learn from professionals from different backgrounds and with different cultures
• *About Cherry Bekaert**

Cherry Bekaert, ranked among the largest assurance, tax and advisory firms in the U.S., serves clients across industries in all 50 U.S. states and internationally. Cherry Bekaert is the brand name under which Cherry Bekaert LLP and Cherry Bekaert Advisory LLC, independently owned entities, provide professional services in an alternative practice structure in accordance with applicable professional standards. Cherry Bekaert LLP is a licensed CPA firm that provides attest services, and Cherry Bekaert Advisory LLC and its subsidiary entities provide business advisory and non-attest services spanning the areas of transaction advisory, risk and accounting advisory, digital solutions, cybersecurity, tax, benefits consulting, and wealth management. For more details, visit .

Cherry Bekaert cares about our people. We offer competitive compensation packages based on performance that recognize the value our people bring to our clients and our Firm. The salary range for this position is $55,000 to $158,125. In addition, we offer a comprehensive, high-quality benefits program ) which includes annual bonus, medical, dental, and vision care; disability and life insurance; generous Paid Time Off; retirement plans; Paid Care Leave; and other programs that are dedicated to enhancing your personal and work life and providing you and your family with a measure of financial protection.

Cherry Bekaert provides equal employment opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law.

Candidates must demonstrate eligibility to work in the United States. Cherry Bekaert will not provide work sponsorship for this position.

Cherry Bekaert LLP and Cherry Bekaert Advisory LLC are members of Allinial Global, an accountancy and business advisory global association. Visit us at and follow us on LinkedIn ) , Glassdoor ,) , Instagram ) , Twitter ) and Facebook ) .

data.job_description:
• *Description**
• *Job Summary**

The data analyst will collect, analyze, interpret, and apply sales and marketing data to improve decision-making, accelerate revenue growth and drive related business outcomes.

This position will transform raw data into useful information, actionable insights, key metrics and easy to understand explanations that answer important sales and marketing questions for company staff and stakeholders.

This position is integral in the company pursuit of a data driven operating model (DDOM).
• *Duties & Responsibilities**

This position requires a mix of technical, analytical, and soft skills to effectively analyze data and communicate their findings. Duties and responsibilities include the following:

+ Work with stakeholders and management to prioritize business information needs.

+ Solicit and collaborate with business stakeholders to understand what data and cascading information is most helpful in aiding the most important business outcomes.

+ Identify primary, secondary, and other data sources and the tools to extract, integrate or sync data.

+ Use query tools to extract data from different types of business systems.

+ Streamline data collection methods to create automated and easy-to-use routines.

+ Append first- and third-party data to a data lake or customer data platform.

+ Apply validation rules to identify data quality issues and apply technology to resolve data quality issues where possible.

+ Perform data analysis to assess the quality and meaning of data.

+ Perform data mining and Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA) to identify, analyze, and interpret patterns and trends for predictive analytics. We seek forward-looking information.

+ Prepare dashboards and reports for management stating trends, patterns, and predictions using relevant data.

+ Work with sales managers and practitioners to identify process improvement opportunities and quantify those opportunities so they can be prioritized.

+ Present and effectively communicate data findings and insights to sales and marketing business practitioners.
• *Required Skills & Abilities**
• *Competencies required for this role include the following:**

+ Critical thinking, including the ability to approach problems logically and make informed decisions based on data.

+ Business development, sales, digital marketing domain expertise.

+ Problem-solving, including coming up with solutions to business problems using data-driven approaches.

+ Communication skills, including clearly conveying findings, both written and orally, to non-technical stakeholders.

+ Business analyst skills, including strong conversation skills to elicit objectives and requirements from staff and management.

+ Analytical skills, including the ability to visualize and measure data flows with business processes. This includes data mapping techniques, such as Universal Process Notation (UPN), the Component Business Model (CBM) or Agile Value Stream Mapping.

+ Create highly visual dashboards and reports to communicate insights to stakeholders.
• *Technical skills required for this role include the following:**

+ Data governance, including data privacy, security, regulatory and compliance requirements.

+ Data management, quality, query (SQL), modeling, and integration skills.

+ Database access, retrieval, manipulation and modeling skills.

+ Business Intelligence (BI) tools such as Microsoft Power BI, Tableau, Alteryx

+ Predictive analytics tools.

+ Data append, maintenance and enrichment tools.

+ MarTech, including Marketing Automation Platforms (MAP) such as Adobe Marketo, HubSpot, Microsoft Dynamics Marketing or Salesforce Marketing Cloud.

+ Customer Data Platforms, such as the Adobe CDP, Dynamics Insights or Data Cloud.

+ CRM systems such as Microsoft Dynamics CE or Salesforce.

+ Sales Tech, including Sales Enablement, Sales Operations, and sales processes.

+ Knowledge of programming languages, such as Python (including libraries like pandas, numpy, and scikit-learn for data manipulation and analysis) and R (for statistical analysis and data visualization) are helpful, but not required.

+ Data Lakes and enterprise data warehouses.

+ AI and machine learning skills are highly regarded.
• *Required Education and/or Certifications**

+ BS in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics, Marketing

+ Digital Marketing Certifications
• *What you can expect from us:**

+ Our shared values that foster inclusion and belonging including uncompromising integrity, collaboration, trust, and mutual respect

+ The opportunity to innovate and do work that motivates and engages you

+ A collaborative environment focused on enabling you to further your career growth and continuous professional development

+ Competitive compensation and a total rewards package that focuses on all aspects of your wellbeing

+ Flexibility to do impactful work and the time to enjoy your life outside of work

+ Opportunities to connect and learn from professionals from different backgrounds and with different cultures
• *About Cherry Bekaert**

Cherry Bekaert, ranked among the largest assurance, tax and advisory firms in the U.S., serves clients across industries in all 50 U.S. states and internationally. Cherry Bekaert is the brand name under which Cherry Bekaert LLP and Cherry Bekaert Advisory LLC, independently owned entities, provide professional services in an alternative practice structure in accordance with applicable professional standards. Cherry Bekaert LLP is a licensed CPA firm that provides attest services, and Cherry Bekaert Advisory LLC and its subsidiary entities provide business advisory and non-attest services spanning the areas of transaction advisory, risk and accounting advisory, digital solutions, cybersecurity, tax, benefits consulting, and wealth management. For more details, visit .

Cherry Bekaert cares about our people. We offer competitive compensation packages based on performance that recognize the value our people bring to our clients and our Firm. The salary range for this position is $55,000 to $158,125. In addition, we offer a comprehensive, high-quality benefits program ) which includes annual bonus, medical, dental, and vision care; disability and life insurance; generous Paid Time Off; retirement plans; Paid Care Leave; and other programs that are dedicated to enhancing your personal and work life and providing you and your family with a measure of financial protection.

Cherry Bekaert provides equal employment opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law.

Candidates must demonstrate eligibility to work in the United States. Cherry Bekaert will not provide work sponsorship for this position.

Cherry Bekaert LLP and Cherry Bekaert Advisory LLC are members of Allinial Global, an accountancy and business advisory global association. Visit us at and follow us on LinkedIn ) , Glassdoor ,) , Instagram ) , Twitter ) and Facebook ) .

data.job_description:
The Sr Business Data Analyst will be responsible for completing complex business system and data analytic assignments in support of departmental objectives, functioning as a senior analytic and technical lead on a broad array of assignments.

Key Responsibilities/Duties what you will be doing
• Collaborates with internal business and external vendor constituents to conduct analytic assignments in support of requested business solution(s).
• Creates a technology roadmap in support of a business strategy with business leadership across multiple departments.
• Ensures that appropriate requirements, associated business rules and data standards, and technical specifications for requested solutions are documented.
• Develops design recommendations commensurate of requested solution, ensuring recommendations comply with corporate architectural standards and federal and state regulations and/or mandates pertaining to the privacy and security of the companys core data assets.
• Facilitates review of design with governing committees.
• Plans, develops and implements solution designs of significant scope and complexity.
• Solutions may include application or extract program code, production reports and analytic finding reports. Independently develops solutions of considerable scope and complexity.
• Leads teams of junior analysts to fulfill components of solutions with significant scope and complexity.
• Leads quality assurance (QA) and user acceptance testing planning for developed solutions, and participates with business requesters in their user acceptance testing once QA testing is successfully completed.
• Develops and trains IT and business personnel on test strategies, plans, and scripts and executes test procedures to ensure compliance of developed solution with documented specifications. Reports test results to project stakeholders.
• Collaborates to maintain core reference domain content via master data management tools. Monitors core dataset quality thresholds to identify dataset content issues that require resolution.
• Initiates and manages constituent-specific data remediation projects to resolve prioritized issues.
• Monitors production processes of previously implemented information management solutions to proactively achieve error-free performance standards.
• Performs analysis to establish root cause(s) of identified issues through implementation and documentation of necessary modifications.
• Perform out-of-the-box thinking, collaborate with others, and make a difference every day
• Other duties and projects as assigned.

Qualifications what you need to perform the job
• MA/MBA/MS or equivalent exp. Advanced degree.
• 5 years of experience, including a minimum of 3 years in health care data warehouse environment.
• Experience in MicroStrategy Web report development, understanding of its architecture and schema objects;
• Experience with documenting requirements, use cases, test cases, success criteria
• Experience in Master Data Management.
• Experience in database systems (Teradata, Oracle), as well as end-user analytic tools like MicroStrategy Web
• Superior analytic problem-solving skills, including business process and data analytics.
• Data knowledge in finance or clinical side of insurance business; demonstrated ability to develop and deliver data analytic solutions of a complex nature.

Who We Are

Point32Health is a leading health and wellbeing organization, delivering an ever-better personalized health care experience to everyone in our communities. At Point32Health, we are building on the quality, nonprofit heritage of our founding organizations, Tufts Health Plan and Harvard Pilgrim Health Care, where we leverage our experience and expertise to help people find their version of healthier living through a broad range of health plans and tools that make navigating health and wellbeing easier.

We enjoy the important work we do every day in service to our members, partners, colleagues and communities.

This job has been posted by Ignyte AI on behalf of Point32Health. Ignyte AI is committed to the fundamental principle of equal opportunity and equal treatment for every prospective and current employee. It is the policy of Ignyte AI not to discriminate based on race, color, national or ethnic origin, ancestry, age, religion, creed, disability, sex and gender, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under applicable federal, state or local law.

Req ID: R7047, R7048

Qualifications: MA/MBA/MS or equivalent exp
5 years of experience, including a minimum of 3 years in health care data warehouse environment
Experience in MicroStrategy Web report development, understanding of its architecture and schema objects;
Experience with documenting requirements, use cases, test cases, success criteria
Experience in Master Data Management
Experience in database systems (Teradata, Oracle), as well as end-user analytic tools like MicroStrategy Web
Superior analytic problem-solving skills, including business process and data analytics
Data knowledge in finance or clinical side of insurance business; demonstrated ability to develop and deliver data analytic solutions of a complex nature

data.job_description:
Everything we do at Sunrun is driven by a determination to transform the way we power our lives. We know that starts at the individual employee level. We strive to foster an environment you can thrive in through our commitment to diversity, inclusion and belonging.

Job Summary:

We are looking for a highly skilled and motivated Data Analyst to join a newly established analytics team within the CFOs organization. This new group will play a critical role in defining new corporate metrics of performance excellence.

Responsibilities:

+ Build and maintain financial and operational dashboards (Tableau) to identify patterns and trends which will support decision-making at the C-Level.

+ Develop and maintain robust and scalable financial and operational data models and data dictionaries for both self-consumption and the broader data analyst community.

+ Partner in the overhaul of data pipelines amidst tech stack migration.

+ Collaborate with technical and business teams to implement best practices for data modeling, data governance, and data quality.

Education and Experience:

+ Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Accounting/Finance, Engineering, or a related field

+ Demonstrated ability in data analysis with financial data, generally 2-4 years.

Requirements:

+ Proficient in SQL (preferably Snowflake), Tableau, and Excel/Google Sheets.

+ Hands-on experience working with financial and operational data.

+ A curious attitude with close attention to detail and the ability to see the big picture.

+ Able to thrive among Business and Technical partners as well as across senior and junior team members with the same level of respect and clarity.

+ Strong problem-solving skills, ability to drive with limited oversight, and keep stakeholders informed.

Nice to have:

+ Knowledge or experience in dbt or similar data transformation tools.

+ Knowledge or experience in Oracle Cloud and associated analytical packages.

+ Experience in Python is a plus, but not required.

+ Close proximity to a corporate office: San Francisco, CA; Lehi, UT; Denver, CO; SLO, CA.

Location:

This position is open to candidates who can travel 10-25% to corporate and branch offices throughout the country. Candidates outside of the United States will not be considered.

Note:

We encourage candidates who fall shy of technical requirements to apply, as we value diversity and recognize that skills can be developed through on-the-job learning and training. If you are passionate about using data to drive business decisions and excited about working in the renewable energy industry, we would love to hear from you This is NOT a data science position.
• *Recruiter:**

Amanda Frock )

_Please note that the compensation information that follows is a good faith estimate for this position only and is provided pursuant to acts, such as The Equal Pay Transparency Act. It assumes that the successful candidate will be located in markets within the United States that warrant the compensation listed._ _Candidates in locations outside this local area may have a different starting salary range for this opportunity which may be higher or lower._ _Please speak with your recruiter to learn more._

_Starting salary/wage for this opportunity:_

$60,562.00 to $75,756.00

_Other rewards may include annual bonus eligibility, which is based on company and individual performance, short and long term incentives, and program-specific awards. Sunrun provides a variety of benefits to employees, including health insurance coverage, an employee wellness program, life and disability insurance, a retirement savings plan, paid holidays and paid time off (PTO). A candidates salary history will not be used in compensation decisions._

Work with sales managers and practitioners to identify process improvement opportunities and quantify those opportunities so they can be prioritized
This includes data mapping techniques, such as Universal Process Notation (UPN), the Component Business Model (CBM) or Agile Value Stream Mapping
Create highly visual dashboards and reports to communicate insights to stakeholders
*Technical skills required for this role include the following:**
Data append, maintenance and enrichment tools
Benefits: A collaborative environment focused on enabling you to further your career growth and continuous professional development
Competitive compensation and a total rewards package that focuses on all aspects of your wellbeing
Flexibility to do impactful work and the time to enjoy your life outside of work
Opportunities to connect and learn from professionals from different backgrounds and with different cultures
We offer competitive compensation packages based on performance that recognize the value our people bring to our clients and our Firm
The salary range for this position is $55,000 to $158,125

In addition, we offer a comprehensive, high-quality benefits program ) which includes annual bonus, medical, dental, and vision care; disability and life insurance; generous Paid Time Off; retirement plans; Paid Care Leave; and other programs that are dedicated to enhancing your personal and work life and providing you and your family with a measure of financial protection

data.job_description:
Data Analyst (Power BI)

Job ID

134943

Posted

30-Aug-2023

Service line

GWS Segment

Role type

Full-time

Areas of Interest

Digital & Technology/Information Technology

Location(s)

Remote - US - Remote - US - United States of America

Our Digital & Technology organization sits at the heart of CBRE. As part of our team, youll be able to learn from the most brilliant engineers, designers, and product managers while solving tough problems that will drive our technology forward.
• *About the Role**

The Data Analyst will be responsible for ensuring the business makes better decisions through the collection and usage of data. They will ensure business data and analysis requirements are met by accurately applying data concepts, including data structures, collection and cleansing, and structured and unstructured data analysis and reporting.
• *What Youll Do**

+ Perform ad-hoc, strategic analysis of structured and unstructured data across multiple data sources, reflecting global real estate markets and the operations of real estate assets.

+ Develop data structures and pipelines to coordinate, collect, cleanse, and standardize data in order to generate insights and address reporting needs.

+ Define data requirements and captures and validate information, using judgment and statistical tests.

+ Use programming and analytical tools, including open source programs including Python, R and SAS, SQL, Oracle, or similar relational database tools to formulate models and/or extract insights.

+ Proficient in knowledge of crafting algorithms, identifying patterns and insights from structured and unstructured data sets using graphs, trees and/or other data representation techniques as required.

+ Identifies and fixes data integration and integrity issues in agreement with the appropriate CBRE business units; Designs work flows and procedures.

+ Finds opportunities to improve data usage, applying modeling and optimization methods to develop new strategies and improve business performance.

+ Develops ad-hoc analytics and reporting based on analysis of existing data sources, using a variety of tools (i.e. SSRS, Tableau).

+ Exhibits analytical rigor, judgment, and ability to communicate a comprehensive 'data story' to multiple levels of the organization.
• *What Youll Need**

+ Bachelor's degree from a credible school in computer science, math, engineering, or related field.

+ Proven experience in quantitative analysis, data modeling, reporting, relational database tools, data warehousing, database architecture, and SQL, SAS, and/or SPSS including 2-3 years technical experience in software development, machine learning or statistical analysis, data engineering, and data visualization-related work.

+ Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Strong interpersonal and analytical skills. Ability to deliver efficient, timely, reliable, and courteous service to customers. Ability to effectively present information.

+ Experience with **Microsoft BI** stack (e.g., SSRS) a bonus.

+ Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite including Word, PowerPoint, Excel, and Outlook.

+ Strong analytical skills.
• *Why CBRE?**

CBRE is the world's largest commercial real estate services and investment firm, and we have been ranked #1 on Fortunes Worlds Most Admired Company: (2019, 2020, 2021,2023). With services, insights, and data that span every dimension of the industry, we build digital solutions for clients of every size, in every sector, and across every geography.

_Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States without the need for visa sponsorship now or in the future_

CBRE carefully considers multiple factors to determine compensation, including a candidates education, training, and experience. The minimum salary for the position is **$90,000** annually and the maximum salary for the position is **$95,000** annually. The compensation that is offered to a successful candidate will depend on the candidates skills, qualifications, and experience. Successful candidates will also be eligible for a discretionary bonus based on CBREs applicable benefit program.

CBRE is an equal opportunity employer that values diversity. We have a long-standing commitment to providing equal employment opportunity to all qualified applicants regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, veteran status, political belief, or any other basis protected by applicable law. We also provide reasonable accommodations, as needed, throughout the job application process. If you have a disability that inhibits your ability to apply for a position through our online application process, you may contact us via email at or via telephone at +1 866 225 3099 (U.S.) and +1 866 388 4346 (Canada).

NOTE: Some, but not all, of our positions may have an additional requirement to comply with COVID-19 health and safety protocols, including COVID-19 vaccination proof and/or rigorous testing. If you have questions about the requirement(s) for this position, please inform your Recruiter.
